results_before_filter.title: Fed faiz kararı ne zaman, ayın kaçında açıklanacak? Eylül ayında faiz oranı düşecek mi?
results_before_filter.snippet: The Federal Reserve (Fed) is expected to announce its interest rate decision on July 31st at 21:00. Fed officials, including Christopher Waller, have hinted that the rate reduction is nearing. However, Fed Chairman Jerome Powell has stated that the bank will not provide any signals about the rate decision before the meeting. Powell mentioned that the recent inflation data has improved, but the bank will not ease monetary policy until it is confident that inflation has fallen to 2%. The bank's decision will be based on the data and will be announced after the meeting.

results_after_filter.title: FED FAİZ TOPLPANTI TARİHİ 2024: ABD Merkez Bankası FED faizi açıklandı mı, ne zaman açıklanacak, ne olur?
results_after_filter.snippet: The Federal Reserve (FED) has kept the interest rate at 5.50% in its latest meeting, as announced on September 17-18, 2024. The decision was made with unanimous approval from the FOMC. The FED has stated that it will not reduce the interest rate until it has more confidence that inflation is heading towards its 2% target. Market analysts and investors are closely following the FED's decision, with some expecting a rate cut and others anticipating a hold. According to the FED, the decision will be announced on the evening of September 18, 2024.

results_after_filter.title: FED FAİZ KARARI EYLÜL 2024! FED faiz beklentisi ne yönde? Dolar, altın...
results_after_filter.snippet: The Federal Reserve (FED) has decided to keep the interest rate unchanged. According to the statement, the decision was made with unanimous vote. The statement also mentioned that the recent indicators show that the economic activity is continuing to expand at a strong pace. However, it was noted that the employment growth has slowed down, and the unemployment rate has increased, but remains low. The statement also mentioned that the inflation has decreased, but still remains high. It was said, 'A bit more progress has been made towards the Committee's 2% inflation target in recent months.' The statement reiterated that the long-term goal is to achieve maximum employment and an inflation rate of 2%. It was also stated that the risks to achieving these targets are moving in a better direction. However, the statement emphasized that the economic outlook is uncertain, and the Federal Open Market Committee is cautious about the risks to both targets. To support the targets, the target range for the federal funds rate has been set at 5.25-5.50%.

results_after_filter.title: Inflación sigue sin llegar a meta de Reserva Federal
results_after_filter.snippet: Investors, analysts, and markets are looking for reasons to push the Federal Reserve to reduce its interest rate from the current level of 5.25%-5.50%. However, the reality is that the Federal Reserve's goal is not to reach 3%, but 2%, and it should have been achieved several months ago. The recent job creation and unemployment rate of 4.3% were seen as reasons to pressure the Federal Reserve to hold an emergency meeting to lower its interest rate by 0.5 percentage points immediately. However, the latest inflation data, including the 2.9% consumer price index and 3.2% core inflation rate, indicate that inflation is under control and the Federal Reserve may lower its interest rate in September. However, the author believes that the Federal Reserve will not lower its interest rate in September due to geopolitical uncertainty and the fact that the inflation rate is still above 3%. The author also mentions that the upcoming US presidential election could influence inflation and that the Federal Reserve may decide to wait until November to lower its interest rate. The author concludes that the market's expectation of a 1% interest rate cut may not occur, and if it doesn't, all asset prices will have to reprice again.

results_before_filter.snippet: The Federal Reserve's Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) made a unanimous decision to keep interest rates unchanged at 5.25% to 5.50% per annum, according to a statement released on Wednesday, July 31. The Fed also maintained the interest rate on reserve balances at 5.4% and kept the discount rate unchanged at 5.50% per annum.

results_before_filter.title: FED FAİZ KARARI TEMMUZ 2024 TOPLANTISI: Altın, dolar, borsa... FED faiz kararı ne zaman saat kaçta açıklanacak, FED faizi ne olur?
results_before_filter.snippet: The Federal Reserve (FED) is expected to announce its interest rate decision on July 31, 2024, after its meeting on July 30-31. Investors are closely watching the decision, which is expected to remain unchanged at 5.50%. According to Chairman Powell, the FED has been prioritizing inflation control in recent meetings. The FED's decision is expected to be announced in the evening of July 31. As of now, the possibility of a rate cut is considered low.

results_before_filter.title: US-Notenbank Fed entscheidet über Leitzinsen - erneut keine Senkung erwartet
results_before_filter.snippet: The US Federal Reserve (Fed) will announce its decision on interest rates on Wednesday at 14:00 local time (20:00 CEST). Following the announcement, Fed Chairman Jerome Powell will hold a press conference to discuss the results of the central bank's meeting. Observers expect hints of a potential interest rate cut in September. However, the rates are expected to remain stable between 5.25% and 5.5%, the highest level in over 20 years. The Fed has promised interest rate cuts this year, but has also emphasized the need to avoid acting too quickly to prevent inflation from rising again. The recent trend has been positive, with inflation falling to 3.0% in June, while economic growth and the labor market have remained strong.

results_before_filter.title: The Federal Reserve will make an interest rate decision this week. Here's what to expect.
results_before_filter.snippet: The Federal Reserve is set to make an interest rate decision this week, with economists predicting a rate cut in September. The Fed's current interest rate is 5.25-5.5%, and most economists expect it to remain unchanged until September. The rate cut is expected to be 0.25 percentage points, trimming the benchmark rate to 5-5.25%. The Fed's decision is based on its dual mandate to keep prices stable and ensure maximum employment. Inflation has cooled, and the labor market is slowing, which could lead to a rate cut. A rate cut could bring relief to borrowers, with mortgage rates potentially trending toward 6% by the end of the year.

results_before_filter.title: FED faiz toplantısı ne zaman yapılacak? FED faiz kararını ne zaman açıklayacak?
results_before_filter.snippet: The Federal Reserve (FED) is set to announce its interest rate decision on July 31, 2024, at 21:00. The decision is crucial for the US and global economies. Investors are closely following the FED's announcement, which will take place on July 30-31. The FED's interest rate decision will be publicly disclosed on July 31 at 21:00.

results_before_filter.title: FED faiz kararı ne zaman açıklanacak, hangi tarihte, saat kaçta? 2024 Temmuz ayı FED faiz kararı ne olur? - Sözcü Gazetesi
results_before_filter.snippet: The Federal Reserve (FED) is set to announce its interest rate decision on July 31. According to analysts, the FED's decision will be influenced by the slowing down of economic activity and the expected decrease in inflation. The FED's interest rate decision is expected to be announced on July 31, and analysts believe that there is an 80% chance of a second interest rate cut in December. Jerome Powell, the Chairman of the Federal Reserve, stated that the FED's policy is not suitable for a sustainable 2% target, and that the first quarter data does not support the FED's rate cut.

results_before_filter.title: Fed faiz kararı ne zaman, ayın kaçında açıklanacak? Eylül ayında faiz oranı düşecek mi?
results_before_filter.snippet: The Federal Reserve (Fed) is expected to announce its interest rate decision on July 31st at 21:00. Fed officials, including Christopher Waller, have hinted that the rate reduction is nearing. However, Fed Chairman Jerome Powell has stated that the bank will not provide any signals about the rate decision before the meeting. Powell mentioned that the recent inflation data has improved, but the bank will not ease monetary policy until it is confident that inflation has fallen to 2%. The bank's decision will be based on the data and will be announced after the meeting.

results_after_filter.title: FED FAİZ TOPLPANTI TARİHİ 2024: ABD Merkez Bankası FED faizi açıklandı mı, ne zaman açıklanacak, ne olur?
results_after_filter.snippet: The Federal Reserve (FED) has kept the interest rate at 5.50% in its latest meeting, as announced on September 17-18, 2024. The decision was made with unanimous approval from the FOMC. The FED has stated that it will not reduce the interest rate until it has more confidence that inflation is heading towards its 2% target. Market analysts and investors are closely following the FED's decision, with some expecting a rate cut and others anticipating a hold. According to the FED, the decision will be announced on the evening of September 18, 2024.

results_after_filter.title: FED FAİZ KARARI EYLÜL 2024! FED faiz beklentisi ne yönde? Dolar, altın...
results_after_filter.snippet: The Federal Reserve (FED) has decided to keep the interest rate unchanged. According to the statement, the decision was made with unanimous vote. The statement also mentioned that the recent indicators show that the economic activity is continuing to expand at a strong pace. However, it was noted that the employment growth has slowed down, and the unemployment rate has increased, but remains low. The statement also mentioned that the inflation has decreased, but still remains high. It was said, 'A bit more progress has been made towards the Committee's 2% inflation target in recent months.' The statement reiterated that the long-term goal is to achieve maximum employment and an inflation rate of 2%. It was also stated that the risks to achieving these targets are moving in a better direction. However, the statement emphasized that the economic outlook is uncertain, and the Federal Open Market Committee is cautious about the risks to both targets. To support the targets, the target range for the federal funds rate has been set at 5.25-5.50%.

results_after_filter.title: Inflación sigue sin llegar a meta de Reserva Federal
results_after_filter.snippet: Investors, analysts, and markets are looking for reasons to push the Federal Reserve to reduce its interest rate from the current level of 5.25%-5.50%. However, the reality is that the Federal Reserve's goal is not to reach 3%, but 2%, and it should have been achieved several months ago. The recent job creation and unemployment rate of 4.3% were seen as reasons to pressure the Federal Reserve to hold an emergency meeting to lower its interest rate by 0.5 percentage points immediately. However, the latest inflation data, including the 2.9% consumer price index and 3.2% core inflation rate, indicate that inflation is under control and the Federal Reserve may lower its interest rate in September. However, the author believes that the Federal Reserve will not lower its interest rate in September due to geopolitical uncertainty and the fact that the inflation rate is still above 3%. The author also mentions that the upcoming US presidential election could influence inflation and that the Federal Reserve may decide to wait until November to lower its interest rate. The author concludes that the market's expectation of a 1% interest rate cut may not occur, and if it doesn't, all asset prices will have to reprice again.
results_after_filter.source: Noticias de El Salvador - La Prensa Gráfica | Informate con la verdad

results_before_filter.snippet: The US Federal Reserve (Fed) will announce its decision on interest rates on Wednesday at 14:00 local time (20:00 CEST). Following the announcement, Fed Chairman Jerome Powell will hold a press conference to discuss the results of the central bank's meeting. Observers expect hints of a potential interest rate cut in September. However, the rates are expected to remain stable between 5.25% and 5.5%, the highest level in over 20 years. The Fed has promised interest rate cuts this year, but has also emphasized the need to avoid acting too quickly to prevent inflation from rising again. The recent trend has been positive, with inflation falling to 3.0% in June, while economic growth and the labor market have remained strong.

results_before_filter.title: The Federal Reserve will make an interest rate decision this week. Here's what to expect.
results_before_filter.snippet: The Federal Reserve is set to make an interest rate decision this week, with economists predicting a rate cut in September. The Fed's current interest rate is 5.25-5.5%, and most economists expect it to remain unchanged until September. The rate cut is expected to be 0.25 percentage points, trimming the benchmark rate to 5-5.25%. The Fed's decision is based on its dual mandate to keep prices stable and ensure maximum employment. Inflation has cooled, and the labor market is slowing, which could lead to a rate cut. A rate cut could bring relief to borrowers, with mortgage rates potentially trending toward 6% by the end of the year.

results_before_filter.title: Fed faiz kararı ne zaman, ayın kaçında açıklanacak? Eylül ayında faiz oranı düşecek mi?
results_before_filter.snippet: The Federal Reserve (Fed) is expected to announce its interest rate decision on July 31st at 21:00. Fed officials, including Christopher Waller, have hinted that the rate reduction is nearing. However, Fed Chairman Jerome Powell has stated that the bank will not provide any signals about the rate decision before the meeting. Powell mentioned that the recent inflation data has improved, but the bank will not ease monetary policy until it is confident that inflation has fallen to 2%. The bank's decision will be based on the data and will be announced after the meeting.

results_after_filter.title: FED FAİZ TOPLPANTI TARİHİ 2024: ABD Merkez Bankası FED faizi açıklandı mı, ne zaman açıklanacak, ne olur?
results_after_filter.snippet: The Federal Reserve (FED) has kept the interest rate at 5.50% in its latest meeting, as announced on September 17-18, 2024. The decision was made with unanimous approval from the FOMC. The FED has stated that it will not reduce the interest rate until it has more confidence that inflation is heading towards its 2% target. Market analysts and investors are closely following the FED's decision, with some expecting a rate cut and others anticipating a hold. According to the FED, the decision will be announced on the evening of September 18, 2024.

results_after_filter.title: FED FAİZ KARARI EYLÜL 2024! FED faiz beklentisi ne yönde? Dolar, altın...
results_after_filter.snippet: The Federal Reserve (FED) has decided to keep the interest rate unchanged. According to the statement, the decision was made with unanimous vote. The statement also mentioned that the recent indicators show that the economic activity is continuing to expand at a strong pace. However, it was noted that the employment growth has slowed down, and the unemployment rate has increased, but remains low. The statement also mentioned that the inflation has decreased, but still remains high. It was said, 'A bit more progress has been made towards the Committee's 2% inflation target in recent months.' The statement reiterated that the long-term goal is to achieve maximum employment and an inflation rate of 2%. It was also stated that the risks to achieving these targets are moving in a better direction. However, the statement emphasized that the economic outlook is uncertain, and the Federal Open Market Committee is cautious about the risks to both targets. To support the targets, the target range for the federal funds rate has been set at 5.25-5.50%.

results_after_filter.title: Inflación sigue sin llegar a meta de Reserva Federal
results_after_filter.snippet: Investors, analysts, and markets are looking for reasons to push the Federal Reserve to reduce its interest rate from the current level of 5.25%-5.50%. However, the reality is that the Federal Reserve's goal is not to reach 3%, but 2%, and it should have been achieved several months ago. The recent job creation and unemployment rate of 4.3% were seen as reasons to pressure the Federal Reserve to hold an emergency meeting to lower its interest rate by 0.5 percentage points immediately. However, the latest inflation data, including the 2.9% consumer price index and 3.2% core inflation rate, indicate that inflation is under control and the Federal Reserve may lower its interest rate in September. However, the author believes that the Federal Reserve will not lower its interest rate in September due to geopolitical uncertainty and the fact that the inflation rate is still above 3%. The author also mentions that the upcoming US presidential election could influence inflation and that the Federal Reserve may decide to wait until November to lower its interest rate. The author concludes that the market's expectation of a 1% interest rate cut may not occur, and if it doesn't, all asset prices will have to reprice again.
results_after_filter.source: Noticias de El Salvador - La Prensa Gráfica | Informate con la verdad

results_before_filter.title: US-Notenbank Fed entscheidet über Leitzinsen - erneut keine Senkung erwartet
results_before_filter.snippet: The US Federal Reserve (Fed) will announce its decision on interest rates on Wednesday at 14:00 local time (20:00 CEST). Following the announcement, Fed Chairman Jerome Powell will hold a press conference to discuss the results of the central bank's meeting. Observers expect hints of a potential interest rate cut in September. However, the rates are expected to remain stable between 5.25% and 5.5%, the highest level in over 20 years. The Fed has promised interest rate cuts this year, but has also emphasized the need to avoid acting too quickly to prevent inflation from rising again. The recent trend has been positive, with inflation falling to 3.0% in June, while economic growth and the labor market have remained strong.

results_before_filter.title: The Federal Reserve will make an interest rate decision this week. Here's what to expect.
results_before_filter.snippet: The Federal Reserve is set to make an interest rate decision this week, with economists predicting a rate cut in September. The Fed's current interest rate is 5.25-5.5%, and most economists expect it to remain unchanged until September. The rate cut is expected to be 0.25 percentage points, trimming the benchmark rate to 5-5.25%. The Fed's decision is based on its dual mandate to keep prices stable and ensure maximum employment. Inflation has cooled, and the labor market is slowing, which could lead to a rate cut. A rate cut could bring relief to borrowers, with mortgage rates potentially trending toward 6% by the end of the year.

results_before_filter.title: Fed faiz kararı ne zaman, ayın kaçında açıklanacak? Eylül ayında faiz oranı düşecek mi?
results_before_filter.snippet: The Federal Reserve (Fed) is expected to announce its interest rate decision on July 31st at 21:00. Fed officials, including Christopher Waller, have hinted that the rate reduction is nearing. However, Fed Chairman Jerome Powell has stated that the bank will not provide any signals about the rate decision before the meeting. Powell mentioned that the recent inflation data has improved, but the bank will not ease monetary policy until it is confident that inflation has fallen to 2%. The bank's decision will be based on the data and will be announced after the meeting.

results_after_filter.title: FED FAİZ TOPLPANTI TARİHİ 2024: ABD Merkez Bankası FED faizi açıklandı mı, ne zaman açıklanacak, ne olur?
results_after_filter.snippet: The Federal Reserve (FED) has kept the interest rate at 5.50% in its latest meeting, as announced on September 17-18, 2024. The decision was made with unanimous approval from the FOMC. The FED has stated that it will not reduce the interest rate until it has more confidence that inflation is heading towards its 2% target. Market analysts and investors are closely following the FED's decision, with some expecting a rate cut and others anticipating a hold. According to the FED, the decision will be announced on the evening of September 18, 2024.

results_after_filter.title: FED FAİZ KARARI EYLÜL 2024! FED faiz beklentisi ne yönde? Dolar, altın...
results_after_filter.snippet: The Federal Reserve (FED) has decided to keep the interest rate unchanged. According to the statement, the decision was made with unanimous vote. The statement also mentioned that the recent indicators show that the economic activity is continuing to expand at a strong pace. However, it was noted that the employment growth has slowed down, and the unemployment rate has increased, but remains low. The statement also mentioned that the inflation has decreased, but still remains high. It was said, 'A bit more progress has been made towards the Committee's 2% inflation target in recent months.' The statement reiterated that the long-term goal is to achieve maximum employment and an inflation rate of 2%. It was also stated that the risks to achieving these targets are moving in a better direction. However, the statement emphasized that the economic outlook is uncertain, and the Federal Open Market Committee is cautious about the risks to both targets. To support the targets, the target range for the federal funds rate has been set at 5.25-5.50%.

results_after_filter.title: Inflación sigue sin llegar a meta de Reserva Federal
results_after_filter.snippet: Investors, analysts, and markets are looking for reasons to push the Federal Reserve to reduce its interest rate from the current level of 5.25%-5.50%. However, the reality is that the Federal Reserve's goal is not to reach 3%, but 2%, and it should have been achieved several months ago. The recent job creation and unemployment rate of 4.3% were seen as reasons to pressure the Federal Reserve to hold an emergency meeting to lower its interest rate by 0.5 percentage points immediately. However, the latest inflation data, including the 2.9% consumer price index and 3.2% core inflation rate, indicate that inflation is under control and the Federal Reserve may lower its interest rate in September. However, the author believes that the Federal Reserve will not lower its interest rate in September due to geopolitical uncertainty and the fact that the inflation rate is still above 3%. The author also mentions that the upcoming US presidential election could influence inflation and that the Federal Reserve may decide to wait until November to lower its interest rate. The author concludes that the market's expectation of a 1% interest rate cut may not occur, and if it doesn't, all asset prices will have to reprice again.
results_after_filter.source: Noticias de El Salvador - La Prensa Gráfica | Informate con la verdad

results_before_filter.title: US-Notenbank Fed entscheidet über Leitzinsen - erneut keine Senkung erwartet
results_before_filter.snippet: The US Federal Reserve (Fed) will announce its decision on interest rates on Wednesday at 14:00 local time (20:00 CEST). Following the announcement, Fed Chairman Jerome Powell will hold a press conference to discuss the results of the central bank's meeting. Observers expect hints of a potential interest rate cut in September. However, the rates are expected to remain stable between 5.25% and 5.5%, the highest level in over 20 years. The Fed has promised interest rate cuts this year, but has also emphasized the need to avoid acting too quickly to prevent inflation from rising again. The recent trend has been positive, with inflation falling to 3.0% in June, while economic growth and the labor market have remained strong.

results_before_filter.title: The Federal Reserve will make an interest rate decision this week. Here's what to expect.
results_before_filter.snippet: The Federal Reserve is set to make an interest rate decision this week, with economists predicting a rate cut in September. The Fed's current interest rate is 5.25-5.5%, and most economists expect it to remain unchanged until September. The rate cut is expected to be 0.25 percentage points, trimming the benchmark rate to 5-5.25%. The Fed's decision is based on its dual mandate to keep prices stable and ensure maximum employment. Inflation has cooled, and the labor market is slowing, which could lead to a rate cut. A rate cut could bring relief to borrowers, with mortgage rates potentially trending toward 6% by the end of the year.

results_before_filter.title: Fed faiz kararı ne zaman, ayın kaçında açıklanacak? Eylül ayında faiz oranı düşecek mi?
results_before_filter.snippet: The Federal Reserve (Fed) is expected to announce its interest rate decision on July 31st at 21:00. Fed officials, including Christopher Waller, have hinted that the rate reduction is nearing. However, Fed Chairman Jerome Powell has stated that the bank will not provide any signals about the rate decision before the meeting. Powell mentioned that the recent inflation data has improved, but the bank will not ease monetary policy until it is confident that inflation has fallen to 2%. The bank's decision will be based on the data and will be announced after the meeting.

results_after_filter.title: FED FAİZ TOPLPANTI TARİHİ 2024: ABD Merkez Bankası FED faizi açıklandı mı, ne zaman açıklanacak, ne olur?
results_after_filter.snippet: The Federal Reserve (FED) has kept the interest rate at 5.50% in its latest meeting, as announced on September 17-18, 2024. The decision was made with unanimous approval from the FOMC. The FED has stated that it will not reduce the interest rate until it has more confidence that inflation is heading towards its 2% target. Market analysts and investors are closely following the FED's decision, with some expecting a rate cut and others anticipating a hold. According to the FED, the decision will be announced on the evening of September 18, 2024.

results_after_filter.title: FED FAİZ KARARI EYLÜL 2024! FED faiz beklentisi ne yönde? Dolar, altın...
results_after_filter.snippet: The Federal Reserve (FED) has decided to keep the interest rate unchanged. According to the statement, the decision was made with unanimous vote. The statement also mentioned that the recent indicators show that the economic activity is continuing to expand at a strong pace. However, it was noted that the employment growth has slowed down, and the unemployment rate has increased, but remains low. The statement also mentioned that the inflation has decreased, but still remains high. It was said, 'A bit more progress has been made towards the Committee's 2% inflation target in recent months.' The statement reiterated that the long-term goal is to achieve maximum employment and an inflation rate of 2%. It was also stated that the risks to achieving these targets are moving in a better direction. However, the statement emphasized that the economic outlook is uncertain, and the Federal Open Market Committee is cautious about the risks to both targets. To support the targets, the target range for the federal funds rate has been set at 5.25-5.50%.

results_after_filter.title: Inflación sigue sin llegar a meta de Reserva Federal
results_after_filter.snippet: Investors, analysts, and markets are looking for reasons to push the Federal Reserve to reduce its interest rate from the current level of 5.25%-5.50%. However, the reality is that the Federal Reserve's goal is not to reach 3%, but 2%, and it should have been achieved several months ago. The recent job creation and unemployment rate of 4.3% were seen as reasons to pressure the Federal Reserve to hold an emergency meeting to lower its interest rate by 0.5 percentage points immediately. However, the latest inflation data, including the 2.9% consumer price index and 3.2% core inflation rate, indicate that inflation is under control and the Federal Reserve may lower its interest rate in September. However, the author believes that the Federal Reserve will not lower its interest rate in September due to geopolitical uncertainty and the fact that the inflation rate is still above 3%. The author also mentions that the upcoming US presidential election could influence inflation and that the Federal Reserve may decide to wait until November to lower its interest rate. The author concludes that the market's expectation of a 1% interest rate cut may not occur, and if it doesn't, all asset prices will have to reprice again.
results_after_filter.source: Noticias de El Salvador - La Prensa Gráfica | Informate con la verdad

results_before_filter.title: Apple could announce brand new device for the UK this week
results_before_filter.snippet: Apple is set to announce new software updates for its popular products, including the iPhone, at its annual Worldwide Developer Conference (WWDC) this week. Rumors suggest that the company may also announce the release date and price for its virtual reality headset, Apple Vision Pro, in the UK. The device, which costs $3,499 in the US, is expected to be launched in the UK, with a possible price of £3,499. Apple analyst Ming-Chi Kuo believes that the company will launch the Vision Pro outside the US before WWDC, which could indicate that the UK release is imminent. The conference will take place from June 10-14 and will focus on updates to iOS, iPadOS, macOS, tvOS, and watchOS.

results_before_filter.title: Apple Vision Pro: Was hat sich seit dem Start bei der Brille getan?
results_before_filter.snippet: The Apple Vision Pro is expected to launch in Germany soon, possibly in June or July. Apple will likely announce the VisionOS 2 operating system at its developer conference on June 10th, which will bring new features to the current version. Since the Vision Pro's launch in the US in February, Apple has been working on improving the system. The most notable change is the improved Personas, which are virtual avatars that can be used in video conferencing. They now look more lifelike and can be displayed in 3D space. Other improvements include better integration with Mobile Device Management (MDM) for businesses and education, and a new accessibility feature for the hearing impaired. Third-party apps are also being developed, such as Mindr, which allows users to place reminders in 3D space, and HomeUI, which enables users to control smart home devices with virtual buttons. The article also mentions the potential for native apps on the Vision Pro, improved Siri functionality, and the possibility of multi-user accounts and shared experiences.

results_before_filter.title: Apple Vision Pro sera commercialisé à l'international en juillet prochain • Jagat Review
results_before_filter.snippet: Apple will officially launch the Vision Pro internationally in July. The device, also known as a 'spatial computer', combines virtual and real-world experiences to support productivity and entertainment. It can be used for various activities, such as working with Microsoft Office or watching realistic movies. Apple Stores in the UK, Canada, and China will receive shipments of the Vision Pro in the third or fourth week of July. Apple will also announce international sales information for the Vision Pro at its WWDC 2024 event on July 10.

results_before_filter.title: Apple treina funcionários para estreia global do Vision Pro
results_before_filter.snippet: Apple is training employees in 9 countries, including Canada and the UK, for the global launch of the Vision Pro, a mixed reality headset. The device was initially expected to be released in 7 countries, but it will now also be available in Canada and the UK. The WWDC 2024 event, scheduled for June 10, may mark not only the announcement of visionOS 2 but also the international launch of the Apple Vision Pro. The company's strategy is to increase public interest and developer interest in the expensive headset, which costs at least $3,499. The Vision Pro has seen a lack of interest due to its high price and limited usability for everyday consumers, who can perform tasks and more with devices they already have, such as iPhone, iPad, and Mac.

results_before_filter.title: Apple insider reveals where Vision Pro will launch next, and it's good news for the UK & Canada
results_before_filter.snippet: Apple is expected to announce the next launch locations for its Vision Pro product during its WWDC 2024 keynote. According to Apple insider Mark Gurman, the UK, Canada, and Singapore are among the new markets that will receive the Vision Pro. This expansion is part of Apple's push into

results_before_filter.title: Apple Vision Pro wird wohl schon bald auch in Deutschland starten
results_before_filter.snippet: Apple's Mixed-Reality-Brille, Vision Pro, has been available since the beginning of 2024, but the initial hype has cooled down, resulting in lower sales. The international market is expected to bring new impulses. Apple has flown hundreds of employees from international stores to Cupertino for training on the Vision Pro, where they will learn how to demonstrate and explain the product to customers. The training course lasts four days. According to Bloomberg, the release date is planned for after the Worldwide Developers Conference (WWDC) from June 10 to 14. results_after_filter.title: Apple Vision Pro: Was hat sich seit dem Start bei der Brille getan?
results_after_filter.snippet: The Apple Vision Pro is expected to launch in Germany soon, possibly in June or July. Apple will likely announce the VisionOS 2 operating system at its developer conference on June 10th, which will bring new features to the current version. Since the Vision Pro's launch in the US in February, Apple has been working on improving the system. The most notable change is the improved Personas, which are virtual avatars that can be used in video conferencing. They now look more lifelike and can be displayed in 3D space. Other improvements include better integration with Mobile Device Management (MDM) for businesses and education, and a new accessibility feature for the hearing impaired. Third-party apps are also being developed, such as Mindr, which allows users to place reminders in 3D space, and HomeUI, which enables users to control smart home devices with virtual buttons. The article also mentions the potential for native apps on the Vision Pro, improved Siri functionality, and the possibility of multi-user accounts and shared experiences.

According to a report, Apple will reveal the countries where the Apple Vision Pro will be available, including some surprises. Germany, France, Australia, Japan, South Korea, Singapore, and China are expected to be part of the first international markets, while Canada and the UK are missing from the list. The Apple Vision Pro's launch has been unusual, with a long lead time between announcement and availability.

results_before_filter.title: Apple pisa el acelerador para lanzar el Vision Pro fuera de EE. UU.
results_before_filter.snippet: Apple is preparing to launch the Vision Pro internationally. According to Bloomberg's Mark Gurman, Apple has started training employees in various countries on how to demonstrate the device, indicating that the international launch is imminent. The training involves hundreds of employees who have traveled to North America exclusively for this purpose. The course, which lasts up to four days, is aimed at Apple Store employees in China, Singapore, Japan, South Korea, Australia, Germany, and France. Apple has not yet confirmed which countries will be the first to receive the Vision Pro after the US. The company plans to expand the mixed reality glasses to international markets after WWDC 2024, and the formal announcement may be made during the keynote speech on June 10. The international availability is crucial for the device's sales, as it had a promising start in the US but quickly lost momentum. The device's high price and limited optimized apps have been major concerns. Apple may announce new features and updates to visionOS, including support for the Apple Pencil, during the WWDC 2024 event.

results_before_filter.title: What to expect from Apple's May 7 'Let loose' event
results_before_filter.snippet: Apple is hosting a product announcement event on May 7, labeled 'Let loose', which is expected to focus on new iPads and iPad accessories. The event is unusual as it's happening shortly before WWDC, but Apple may be trying to address criticisms about iPads' poor sales, the underwhelming launch of the Vision Pro, and being behind in generative AI technology. The event may focus on new iPads, including a significant redesign of the iPad Pro with OLED displays, and preempting Microsoft's potential announcement of a new chip that could compete with Apple Silicon for AI tasks.

results_before_filter.title: Apple event announced: New iPads and Vision Pro updates expected at major live launch
results_before_filter.snippet: Apple has announced a new 'special event' on May 7th, 2024, where updates to the iPad and possibly the Vision Pro are expected. The event will be live-streamed worldwide at 7am Pacific Time. This is the first launch event of 2024. The invitation features a hand holding an iPad stylus and the phrase 'let loose'. Apple has been rumored to be working on new iPad updates, as the tablet line did not receive any updates in 2023, leading to speculation about new versions. The company may also use the event to announce news about the Vision Pro, Apple's augmented reality headset which was launched in the US but has had little information released about it since. The event location in London is unusual as Apple typically holds launches at its California headquarters. This is the first time Apple has held an event outside the US, following the opening of new offices in London's Battersea Power Station in 2023. Apple has stated that it supports over 550,000 jobs in the UK and has the largest developer community in Europe.

results_after_filter.title: Apple could announce brand new device for the UK this week
results_after_filter.snippet: Apple is set to announce new software updates for its popular products, including the iPhone, at its annual Worldwide Developer Conference (WWDC) this week. Rumors suggest that the company may also announce the release date and price for its virtual reality headset, Apple Vision Pro, in the UK. The device, which costs $3,499 in the US, is expected to be launched in the UK, with a possible price of £3,499. Apple analyst Ming-Chi Kuo believes that the company will launch the Vision Pro outside the US before WWDC, which could indicate that the UK release is imminent. The conference will take place from June 10-14 and will focus on updates to iOS, iPadOS, macOS, tvOS, and watchOS.

results_after_filter.title: Apple Vision Pro: Was hat sich seit dem Start bei der Brille getan?
results_after_filter.snippet: The Apple Vision Pro is expected to launch in Germany soon, possibly in June or July. Apple will likely announce the VisionOS 2 operating system at its developer conference on June 10th, which will bring new features to the current version. Since the Vision Pro's launch in the US in February, Apple has been working on improving the system. The most notable change is the improved Personas, which are virtual avatars that can be used in video conferencing. They now look more lifelike and can be displayed in 3D space. Other improvements include better integration with Mobile Device Management (MDM) for businesses and education, and a new accessibility feature for the hearing impaired. Third-party apps are also being developed, such as Mindr, which allows users to place reminders in 3D space, and HomeUI, which enables users to control smart home devices with virtual buttons. The article also mentions the potential for native apps on the Vision Pro, improved Siri functionality, and the possibility of multi-user accounts and shared experiences.

The training involves hundreds of employees who have traveled to North America exclusively for this purpose. The course, which lasts up to four days, is aimed at Apple Store employees in China, Singapore, Japan, South Korea, Australia, Germany, and France. Apple has not yet confirmed which countries will be the first to receive the Vision Pro after the US. The company plans to expand the mixed reality glasses to international markets after WWDC 2024, and the formal announcement may be made during the keynote speech on June 10. The international availability is crucial for the device's sales, as it had a promising start in the US but quickly lost momentum. The device's high price and limited optimized apps have been major concerns. Apple may announce new features and updates to visionOS, including support for the Apple Pencil, during the WWDC 2024 event.

results_before_filter.title: What to expect from Apple's May 7 'Let loose' event
results_before_filter.snippet: Apple is hosting a product announcement event on May 7, labeled 'Let loose', which is expected to focus on new iPads and iPad accessories. The event is unusual as it's happening shortly before WWDC, but Apple may be trying to address criticisms about iPads' poor sales, the underwhelming launch of the Vision Pro, and being behind in generative AI technology. The event may focus on new iPads, including a significant redesign of the iPad Pro with OLED displays, and preempting Microsoft's potential announcement of a new chip that could compete with Apple Silicon for AI tasks.

results_before_filter.title: Apple event announced: New iPads and Vision Pro updates expected at major live launch
results_before_filter.snippet: Apple has announced a new 'special event' on May 7th, 2024, where updates to the iPad and possibly the Vision Pro are expected. The event will be live-streamed worldwide at 7am Pacific Time. This is the first launch event of 2024. The invitation features a hand holding an iPad stylus and the phrase 'let loose'. Apple has been rumored to be working on new iPad updates, as the tablet line did not receive any updates in 2023, leading to speculation about new versions. The company may also use the event to announce news about the Vision Pro, Apple's augmented reality headset which was launched in the US but has had little information released about it since. The event location in London is unusual as Apple typically holds launches at its California headquarters. This is the first time Apple has held an event outside the US, following the opening of new offices in London's Battersea Power Station in 2023. Apple has stated that it supports over 550,000 jobs in the UK and has the largest developer community in Europe.

results_after_filter.title: Apple could announce brand new device for the UK this week
results_after_filter.snippet: Apple is set to announce new software updates for its popular products, including the iPhone, at its annual Worldwide Developer Conference (WWDC) this week. Rumors suggest that the company may also announce the release date and price for its virtual reality headset, Apple Vision Pro, in the UK. The device, which costs $3,499 in the US, is expected to be launched in the UK, with a possible price of £3,499. Apple analyst Ming-Chi Kuo believes that the company will launch the Vision Pro outside the US before WWDC, which could indicate that the UK release is imminent. The conference will take place from June 10-14 and will focus on updates to iOS, iPadOS, macOS, tvOS, and watchOS.

results_after_filter.title: Apple Vision Pro: Was hat sich seit dem Start bei der Brille getan?
results_after_filter.snippet: The Apple Vision Pro is expected to launch in Germany soon, possibly in June or July. Apple will likely announce the VisionOS 2 operating system at its developer conference on June 10th, which will bring new features to the current version. Since the Vision Pro's launch in the US in February, Apple has been working on improving the system. The most notable change is the improved Personas, which are virtual avatars that can be used in video conferencing. They now look more lifelike and can be displayed in 3D space. Other improvements include better integration with Mobile Device Management (MDM) for businesses and education, and a new accessibility feature for the hearing impaired. Third-party apps are also being developed, such as Mindr, which allows users to place reminders in 3D space, and HomeUI, which enables users to control smart home devices with virtual buttons. The article also mentions the potential for native apps on the Vision Pro, improved Siri functionality, and the possibility of multi-user accounts and shared experiences.

results_after_filter.title: Apple Vision Pro sera commercialisé à l'international en juillet prochain • Jagat Review

Apple Stores in the UK, Canada, and China will receive shipments of the Vision Pro in the third or fourth week of July. Apple will also announce international sales information for the Vision Pro at its WWDC 2024 event on July 10.

results_after_filter.title: Apple Vision Pro: Was hat sich seit dem Start bei der Brille getan?
results_after_filter.snippet: The Apple Vision Pro is expected to launch in Germany soon, possibly in June or July. Apple will likely announce the VisionOS 2 operating system at its developer conference on June 10th, which will bring new features to the current version. Since the Vision Pro's launch in the US in February, Apple has been working on improving the system. The most notable change is the improved Personas, which are virtual avatars that can be used in video conferencing. They now look more lifelike and can be displayed in 3D space. Other improvements include better integration with Mobile Device Management (MDM) for businesses and education, and a new accessibility feature for the hearing impaired. Third-party apps are also being developed, such as Mindr, which allows users to place reminders in 3D space, and HomeUI, which enables users to control smart home devices with virtual buttons.
